results.title: Increased small extracellular vesicle secretion after chemotherapy via upregulation of cholesterol metabolism in acute myeloid leukaemia
results.text_hl: Treatment with an @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@ inhibitor, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@, or siRNAs targeting @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@ blocked the chemotherapy-induced enhancement of sEV secretion in @<m>DISEASE_Precursor_T_Cell_Lymphoblastic_Leukemia_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054218 @@@AML@@@ cells. sEVs carry @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@ and chemotherapy enhances @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@ levels in sEVs.

citations.NLM: Hong CS, Jeong E, Boyiadzis M, Whiteside TL. Increased small extracellular vesicle secretion after chemotherapy via upregulation of cholesterol metabolism in acute myeloid leukaemia J Extracell Vesicles. 2020 Aug 7;9(1):1800979. PMID: 32944189
citations.BibTeX: @article{32944189, title={Increased small extracellular vesicle secretion after chemotherapy via upregulation of cholesterol metabolism in acute myeloid leukaemia}, author={Hong CS and Jeong E and Boyiadzis M and Whiteside TL}, journal={J Extracell Vesicles}, volume={9}, number={1}, pages={1800979}}

results.title: CCR9 overexpression promotes T-ALL progression by enhancing cholesterol biosynthesis
results.text_hl: For the chemotaxis assay after @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, cells were treated with different concentrations of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 3 muM, 6 muM, 12 muM and 24 muM, (Sigma, S6196) for 24 h.

citations.NLM: Jamal M, Lei Y, He H, Zeng X, Bangash HI, Xiao D, Shao L, Zhou F, Zhang Q. CCR9 overexpression promotes T-ALL progression by enhancing cholesterol biosynthesis Front Pharmacol. 2023;14():1257289. PMID: 37745085
citations.BibTeX: @article{37745085, title={CCR9 overexpression promotes T-ALL progression by enhancing cholesterol biosynthesis}, author={Jamal M and Lei Y and He H and Zeng X and Bangash HI and Xiao D and Shao L and Zhou F and Zhang Q}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={14}, pages={1257289}}

results.title: Selective inhibition of primary acute myeloid leukaemia cell growth by simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Selective inhibition of primary @<m>DISEASE_Precursor_T_Cell_Lymphoblastic_Leukemia_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054218 @@@acute myeloid leukaemia@@@ cell growth by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Newman A, Clutterbuck RD, Powles RL, Millar JL. Selective inhibition of primary acute myeloid leukaemia cell growth by simvastatin. Leukemia. 1994 Nov;8(11):2023-9. PMID: 7967748
citations.BibTeX: @article{7967748, title={Selective inhibition of primary acute myeloid leukaemia cell growth by simvastatin.}, author={Newman A and Clutterbuck RD and Powles RL and Millar JL}, journal={Leukemia}, volume={8}, number={11}, pages={2023-9}}

results.title: Inhibitory effect of simvastatin on the proliferation of human myeloid leukaemia cells in severe combined immunodeficient (SCID) mice.
results.text_hl: The data suggest that the inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Precursor_T_Cell_Lymphoblastic_Leukemia_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054218 @@@AML@@@ cell proliferation by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may be independent of the RAS signalling pathway.

citations.NLM: Clutterbuck RD, Millar BC, Powles RL, Newman A, Catovsky D, Jarman M, Millar JL. Inhibitory effect of simvastatin on the proliferation of human myeloid leukaemia cells in severe combined immunodeficient (SCID) mice. Br J Haematol. 1998 Jul;102(2):522-7. PMID: 9695968
citations.BibTeX: @article{9695968, title={Inhibitory effect of simvastatin on the proliferation of human myeloid leukaemia cells in severe combined immunodeficient (SCID) mice.}, author={Clutterbuck RD and Millar BC and Powles RL and Newman A and Catovsky D and Jarman M and Millar JL}, journal={Br J Haematol}, volume={102}, number={2}, pages={522-7}}

results.title: A comparison of the effect of the 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors simvastatin, lovastatin and pravastatin on leukaemic and normal bone marrow progenitors.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pravastatin@@@ showed similar growth inhibitory effects to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ in 2 out of 3 primary AMLs but was less active against one primary @<m>DISEASE_Precursor_T_Cell_Lymphoblastic_Leukemia_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054218 @@@AML@@@ cell population and @CELLLINE_CVCL:0002 @@@HL60@@@ cells.

citations.NLM: Newman A, Clutterbuck RD, Powles RL, Catovsky D, Millar JL. A comparison of the effect of the 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitors simvastatin, lovastatin and pravastatin on leukaemic and normal bone marrow progenitors. Leuk Lymphoma. 1997 Feb;24(5-6):533-7. PMID: 9086443

results.title: A pre-clinical model of resistance to induction therapy in pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia
results.text_hl: Had we not proceeded to test @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SVT@@@ in vivo, we too would have concluded a clinical benefit of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SVT@@@ in combination with VXLD.

citations.NLM: Samuels AL, Beesley AH, Yadav BD, Papa RA, Sutton R, Anderson D, Marshall GM, Cole CH, Kees UR, Lock RB. A pre-clinical model of resistance to induction therapy in pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia Blood Cancer J. 2014 Aug 1;4(8):e232. PMID: 25083816
